title: Make angular typings compatible with ES6 promises
body:
Since ES6 promises don't implement finally, trying to $q.when a third
party promises fails typings. This introduces a new type that is
compatible with this, to allow for typings to work when
taking an ES6 promise.

Totally willing to change the name to something more sensible here

title: bootstrap: `document.body` is possibly 'null' in TypeScript@next
body:
I used `document.body` in the tests just as an easy way to get a `HTMLElement` object. This is not a real use case. In this PR, I added a global temporary `HTMLElement` object in the tests to make the intention clear.

I'm against adding `null` to some of the properties. This is not documented and there is no real case scenario for this.

title: Bull: Add types to some private functions
body:
- Job.moveToCompleted
- Job.moveToFailed
- Queue.getNextJob
- Also add null possibility to Queue.getJob

Me and my team are using these functions to implement a multiple-repo job processor service (despite being told by the author that this pattern for Bull isn't [supported](https://github.com/OptimalBits/bull/issues/208#issuecomment-157497444) or [planned](https://github.com/OptimalBits/bull/issues/790#issuecomment-345387700)). We are manually moving jobs from state to state as the `process` function is not being used. Work for a job is being done in another repo and we are exposing these functions via an API. We know these functions are private currently but hopefully with this exposure and a future PR to the actual Bull repo, we can get these functions to be public. We have this working in production for hundreds of jobs per day and this pattern seems to be working just fine.

title: FixType(mongoose): fix issues around undefined(optional) plugin options
body:
Had earlier opened this #27854 but had to close to commit errors.

* Make the Generic `plugin` function's options required(i.e. NonNull), this is to eliminate errors when a plugin requires options(i.e. plugin options must be `NonNull`|`Defined`).
* Add an overload to the generic `plugin` functions in order accommodate Plugins with no options. This eliminates `TS2554: Expected 2 arguments, but got 1.` issues.

Before accepting this pull request I'd like some guidance on how to properly include `types/p5/global.d.ts`, `types/p5/lib/addons/p5.dom.d.ts`, and `types/p5/lib/addons/p5.sound.d.ts` in the types package without having `global.d.ts` pollute global scope automatically and without having the addons augment p5 without being explicitly included by the user. E.g. [unaugmented](https://github.com/p5-types/p5.ts/blob/a1a53e60787e22a8a932aaf9c0a0719686d2bd03/DefinitelyTyped/types/p5/test/unaugmented.ts) should not find the `p5.FFT` class and the `ellipse` function should only be accessible via a p5 instance unless the user explicitly references `global.d.ts` (see the [scripts example](https://github.com/p5-types/p5.ts/blob/a1a53e60787e22a8a932aaf9c0a0719686d2bd03/examples/script/sketch.js))
If possible I'd also like to include the [test directories](https://github.com/p5-types/p5.ts/tree/a1a53e60787e22a8a932aaf9c0a0719686d2bd03/DefinitelyTyped/types/p5) that test global mode and augmenting via the addons.
I've tried to look at how the lodash typings are structured but I couldn't solve this last-mile problem.
